image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: China issues plan to boost household consumption
item.description: China's State Council released directives to boost household consumption including sectors like child and elder care, and food and beverage. Authorities are urged to increase eldercare services and childcare development, alongside income tax reductions for caring for children and seniors. Financial support for small service businesses and promotion of food-themed festivals also featured in the plan.

item.title: US court upholds rule granting work permits for spouses of visa holders
item.description: A US appeals court rejected the challenge to a regulation allowing spouses of H-1B visa holders to work, a rule implemented under President Obama. The court stated that federal immigration law grants the Department of Homeland Security broad regulatory authority, unaffected by a recent Supreme Court ruling limiting agency powers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Foreign nationals told to leave Lebanon as war fears surge
item.description: France and other nations urged foreign nationals to leave Lebanon due to escalating tensions. Hezbollah, backed by Iran, fired rockets at Israel. Meanwhile, Israeli strikes continue in Gaza amidst a protracted conflict with Hamas. The situation raised concerns about a potential wider conflict following the assassination of key militant leaders.

item.title: Two dead in Israel stabbing, assailant killed: medics
item.description: Two people were killed and two others injured in a stabbing attack in Holon, near Tel Aviv. The attack was carried out by a Palestinian suspect from the Israeli-occupied West Bank, who was 'neutralized' by police and later died in hospital. The incident coincides with heightened regional tensions and follows threats of retaliation against Israel by groups backed by Iran.

item.title: Ukraine intensifies its long-range strikes, sinking a Russian submarine and striking an airfield
item.description: Ukraine reported having sunk a Russian submarine and struck an airfield within the last 24 hours, in a series of long-range attacks. These actions come amid increased pressure on Western allies for long-range missile use. Russia indicated that Ukrainian drones also hit an apartment building, causing one casualty. The attacks targeted key Russian military infrastructures.

item.title: NASA welcomes first Isro astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla to International Space Station
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Fears of Middle East war grow after Hamas leader's killing
item.description: Tensions surged in the Middle East as Iran and allies prepared to retaliate for the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh, blamed on Israel. The US is deploying military assets to support Israel. Iran's allies and Hezbollah have vowed revenge, raising fears of a wider regional conflict. Western governments advised citizens to leave Lebanon.

item.title: Violent protests in UK: Over 90 arrested as far-right demonstrations turn into riots
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK government vows 'consequences' for far-right rioters
item.description: The UK government condemned recent violent disorder after police arrested dozens of people during far-right rallies. The unrest, sparked by false rumors about a mass stabbing that killed three young girls, spread across several cities. Prime Minister Keir Starmer vowed strict action against the perpetrators and backed the police to maintain public safety.

item.title: Can Harris win back Arab American voters? The door may be cracked open.
'Stop bullshitting me': Biden rebukes Netanyahu in tense call over Gaza ceasefire

item.title: France calls on citizens in Lebanon to leave 'as soon as possible'
item.description: France urged its citizens in Lebanon to leave immediately due to increasing fears of an all-out war between Israel and Hezbollah. The foreign ministry noted the availability of commercial flights for departure. Sweden also closed its embassy in Beirut, following similar advisories from the US and UK, amid regional tensions.

item.title: Google, Netflix, and OpenAI execs back Harris with high-profile fundraiser
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Woman killed, 3 others wounded in a stabbing attack in Israel
item.description: A woman in her 70s was killed and three others injured in a stabbing incident in Holon, a Tel Aviv suburb. The attacker, reportedly from the West Bank, was neutralised by Israeli police. The incident comes amid heightened regional tensions following recent conflicts involving Hamas and Hezbollah. Medical personnel reported the other victims include two elderly men in critical conditions and a younger man moderately injured.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch video: Uber driver in New York claims racist attack as passenger pepper sprays him ‘because he’s brown’
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Life-threatening' Tropical Storm Debby takes aim at Florida's Gulf Coast
item.description: Tropical Storm Debby, expected to become a life-threatening hurricane, hit Gulf Coast waters and moved north along Florida's coast. The storm, which sparked evacuation orders, was forecast to bring heavy rain, high surf, and storm surges. Governor DeSantis mobilized the National Guard to prepare for its impacts, expected to follow a path similar to Hurricane Ian in 2022.
